userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Kate Felton Elkins Collection, M0125, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous scrapbooks on musical, theatrical and literary subjects. Includes letters, programs, playbills, clippings, printed articles, prints and photographs. One bound volume, Dramatic, has twentieth century letters written to Felton Elkins. ca. 1775-1927.

did.unittitle: DRAMATIC - bound leather book containing autograph and signed letters by 19th and early 20th century theater personalities and others. Also contains old playbills, printed articles, prints and photographs.
to Mrs. K. F. Neilson, Sept. 30, 1925with cover.
Signatures on articles of agreement, Sept. 3, 1822.
Signature on articles of agreement with H.C. Jarrett and H.D. Palmer, March 26, 1875.
Signature on articles of agreement with Rich and Stetson, Dec. 10, 1874.
15. Jefferson, Joseph Autograph. on a card
20. Neilson, Lilian Adelaide, 1850-1880 Autograph theater pass
to Directors of the American Theater
22. Patti, Carlotta and Joseph Hermanns Autographs.
to Felton Elkins, [Mar., 23 1920],signed Dick, with cover.
to F. Elkins, Mar. 24, [1912], Jun. 29, 1912with cover, Apr. 13, 1912.
T.N.S. and 4 to F. Elkins, n.d.
2 and 5 tels (1 holograph) to F. Elkins. n.d., 1918, 1923 and [1915],2 signed Ned
80. Alcazar Theatre Program, 1903with signatures of players
COLLECTION OF CLIPPINGS CONCERNING PEOPLE AND THINGS LITERARY
1. First Editions signed by Elsie B. Stone.
2. Ray Lyman Wilbur to Mrs. Kate Felton Nielson.
3. Nathan Van Patten to Mrs. Kate Felton Nielson.
4. O. W. Holmes to Mr. Sanborn.
SCRAPBOOK OF CONCERT AND OPERA PROGRAMS, 1919-1927

scopecontent.p: Art gallery program, clippings on performers, ballet programs, copies of Symphony Society Bulletin (N.Y.) for San Francisco seasons, 1919-27, and New York and Philadelphia season 1922-23.
Both stage and film productions for San Francisco seasons, 1919-21 and 1923-24 and New York season, 1922-23.

Clippings, photos, concert, theater and opera programs from New York, Philadelphia, Washington, D. C., San Francisco, Menlo Park, Chicago, Boston, Syracuse, Buffalo, St. Louis, Frankfurt a. M., Paris, London, Birmingham, Liverpool and Brighton. A.N.S. from E. N. Palmer (Emma Nevada) to Mrs. Elkins, n.d. (ca. 1885),
Scrapbooks on musical, theatrical and literary subjects

did.unittitle: 1. Dramatics - bound leather book containing autograph letters or signed letters by many persons in the theater in the 19th and early 20th century Also old playbills, prints, printed articles, and photographs.

scopecontent.p: (for item by item of letters & autographs - draft of list of contents for Fe 124)
